lines: Take the survey, linked here.

Find a laptop. Figure out which laptop you're going to bring with you to class with you every day, starting on the day this assignment is due. If this is a hardship, see Mr. Smith immediately; we will find a good solution.
Install Atom on your laptop. Installation instructions are linked here.
Then in Atom *change your theme* and *turn on Soft Wrap* using the info in the middle of the page linked here
Your classmates and I will expect that you have successfully installed Atom and that you are ready to use it before the class when this assignment is due. Thanks!
Read Blown To Bits Chapter 1 (linked here).
In Piazza create a new "Note" (folder "0-intro") and write 100-200 words about how one part of the reading is relevant to you as a student at WUHS.
Be prepared to discuss the entire reading next class.
Finish FirstBlog
Finish Codecademy Lesson "Intro to HTML"
<del>Compile your "two morals" notes into a second blog post.</del> (cancelled at the end of class 09/07)

create a second blog post on your blog, in which you answer (in 100-200 words) the question you took notes on in class last week: "What does a good citizen look like in a world where the Bits authors 'two basic morals' exist?" (book pg 14, pdf pg 17)
return signed research consent form (regardless of your decision to participate)
collect survey data from 5 people not in this class
click one of the 'full article' buttons linked on ACM TechNews, read the full article, and be ready to verbally summarize and discuss it next class
write 200-300 word summary of your ACM TechNews article (which you read over the weekend) and add it to your blog as a new blog post
read/do Images 1 and 1.5 and 2 (links in resources)
post a Piazza note to instructor only with screenshot of Image 2 exercises (code+image)
do IntroComputing exercises for Image 3, Image 4, and Image 5 (including the "optional" one)
post a Piazza note to instructor only with screenshots of the code+images from the Image 5 exercises
do IntroComputing exercises for Image 6
post a Piazza note to instructor only with screenshots of the code+images from the Image 6 exercises
return field trip form

Do Level 10 of the Turtle Blockly Game on your own. Take a screenshot of your Level 10 image and your code, and post it as a public note to Piazza. (start this in class on Tuesday, and work with the partner assigned Monday this week)
Do Image 7 exercises and Image 8 exercises
Create Flipgrid video (<a href=
>link 1 for Lobby Screen) (
>link 2 for Word Count Viz) (
>link 3 for Randomizer)
